official-title.#text: To amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 to clarify that no Federal agency shall be required to consider the social cost of carbon as a condition of compliance with such Act, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title I of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969

header.#text: Agencies not required to consider social cost of carbon

text.#text: No Federal agency shall be required to consider the social cost of carbon as part of any cost-benefit or regulatory analysis of any program, project, activity, or administrative action of the agency as a condition of compliance with this Act.

quote.#tail: has the meaning given the term
means the social cost of carbon as described in the technical support document entitled

, published by the Interagency Working Group on Social Cost of Carbon, United States Government, in May 2013, revised in November 2013, or any successor or substantially related document, or any other estimate of the monetized damages associated with an incremental increase in carbon dioxide emissions in a given year.
quote.#text: Technical Support Document: Technical 15 Update of the Social Cost of Carbon for Regulatory Impact Analysis Under Executive Order No. 12866

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5358 IH: To amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 to clarify that no Federal agency shall be required to consider the social cost of carbon as a condition of compliance with such Act, and for other purposes.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
